div.font: Is the pod in a ready state?

div.div: Is the pod fronted by a service?

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 241px; margin-left: 1244px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; background-color: #ffffff; white-space: nowrap;

display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 80px; height: 1px; padding-top: 366px; margin-left: 1135px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
Does the pod have liveness
checks?

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 248px; margin-left: 1371px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: These can restart the pod whilst it's still coming up if the timing is wrong, or maybe it's just unhealthy. Check the logs if the check seems correct

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 408px; margin-left: 1371px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Check the logs of the pod, the --previous flag can help. Could be OOM, pid 0 exitting or more

switch.text: Check the logs of the pod...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 108px; height: 1px; padding-top: 340px; margin-left: 1521px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Courier New; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 158px; height: 1px; padding-top: 519px; margin-left: 1001px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: If it's been stuck here for a while means the scheduler can't place the pod. This could be for many reasons: can't find cm or secret mounts, image downloading, no capacity or available nodes for selectors/affinities

switch.text: If it's been stuck here fo...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 108px; height: 1px; padding-top: 409px; margin-left: 1021px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: This is when the pod has stopped running and exitted with a zero code. Usual outcome of jobs/non deployment pods

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 625px; margin-left: 1391px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: Containers in pods have exitted with non zero codes and the restart policy doesn't allow for auto restart/self heal

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 742px; margin-left: 1261px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: This is when the pod has been scheduled but communication to the host usually has failed

div.div: Does the pod have readiness checks?

div.div: Port-forward directly to the pod and run the same check locally, eg: curl localhost:$port

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 1px; height: 1px; padding-top: 779px; margin-left: 961px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;

div.div: Exec into the pod and test it locally, try redeploying and double check the readiness spec

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 720px; margin-left: 1051px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: The readiness check is invalid or your app isn't healthy in the pod

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 143px; height: 1px; padding-top: 633px; margin-left: 681px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Courier New; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

kubectl get svc

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1077px; margin-left: 1576px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: If the message shows the loadbalancer app (openresty) then the service backend isn't reponding to the controller or the service is wrong in the ingress resource or they're not in the same namespace?

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1230px; margin-left: 1781px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: If this says default-backend this could mean the rule isn't setup right and isn't forwarding to your app

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 128px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1387px; margin-left: 1576px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div: This is a valid app/something responding. If not as expected double check the ingress service, service selector and pod you've deployed

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 108px; height: 1px; padding-top: 1150px; margin-left: 1281px;

a.text: Viewer does not support full SVG 1.1
